recipe.name: Panaeng Curry (KAENG PHANAENG NEUA)
recipe.instructions:
PANAENG CURRY IS A DRY, RICH, THICK CURRY MADE WITH SMALL AMOUNTS OF COCONUT MILK AND A DRY (PANAENG) CURRY PASTE, WHICH HAS RED CHILLIES, LEMON GRASS, GALANGAL AND PEANUTS. IT IS NOT TOO HOT AND HAS A SWEET AND SOUR TASTE. YOU CAN USE ANY TENDER CUT OF BEEF.
HEAT the oil in a saucepan or wok and stir-fry the curry paste over a medium heat for 2 minutes or until fragrant.
ADD the beef and stir for 5 minutes. Add nearly all of the coconut milk, the fish sauce, palm sugar and tamarind puree and reduce to a low heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 to 7 minutes. Although this is meant to be a dry curry, you can add a little more water during cooking it you feel it is drying out too much. Taste, then adjust the seasoning if necessary.
SPOON the curry into a serving bowl, spoon the last bit of coconut milk over the top and spinkle lime leaves and chilli slices. Serve with cucumber relish.

ingredient.ingredientName: dry curry paste (page 272) or bought paste
beef flank steak, sliced into strips
makrut (kaffir) lime leaves, finely sliced, for garnish
long red chilli, seeded and finely sliced, for garnish
